items.message:
Flooding is possible in this area.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding in this area has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. No further flooding to fields and roads is expected, however there may be standing water seen for several days.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.riverOrSea: Great Stour, East Stour, Aylesford Stream, Ruckinge Dyke, Whitewater Dyke, Stour

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed.  

River levels have now fallen below the level expected to cause flooding. There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. No further rainfall is forecast for today 28/04/23 although further showers are possible on Sunday and Monday.  

We continue to monitor the situation. Our incident response staff are out on the ground checking and clearing any blockages and debris from the Upper Stour.  

Please see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast and remain aware of your local situation.

Flooding is possible in this area. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one. Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.
